td.p: The health of our students, staff, families, communities is of utmost importance as we support all efforts to reduce the impact of COVID-19. In consideration of this unprecedented situation in Wisconsin and the nation, the Public Health Departments support closures for schools to mitigate the spread of COVID-19 in our communities.
Click on this Meal Assistance Link for more information.

Please know that your first, best and most helpful point of contact will be the classroom teacher via email. However, we have also created unique numbers for emergent needs that will serve as a temporary call center for any questions that may arise. This number will reach a BASD staff member (working remotely) on “school” days from March 17-20 and March 30-April 3. If no one answers, please leave a message and know that the call will be returned as soon as possible.
Cooper Elementary: 262-249-6889
Lyons Center Elementary: 262-249-6898
